intro: Psychotria rufovillosa, commonly known as the red-hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria rufovillosa is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and secondary growth areas.
